techmeme.title: Researchers say GPS spoofing has impacted 60K+ commercial flights so far in 2024; GPS could become a relic as Chinese, Russian, and European systems modernize (New York Times)
A global law enforcement operation takes down 593 servers hosting unlicensed versions of Cobalt Strike, a penetration testing tool abused by cybercriminals (Sergiu Gatlan/BleepingComputer)
An investigation details how online gambling giants Flutter and Entain employ practices in the US that they dropped in the UK after admitting risks to UK users (Tom Bergin/Reuters)
OpenText to lay off 1,200 employees and add 800 positions, resulting in a ~1.7% reduction in workforce, and expects to reduce annual expenses by CA$150M in 2025 (CRN)
Canada authorizes the implementation of a 3% levy on revenue from large tech companies that provide digital services to or sell data of Canadian users (Paul Vieira/Wall Street Journal)
